trans-unit.source: Fixed Jupyter for Windows Spark clusters with capital letters clusters
trans-unit.target: Fixed Jupyter for Windows Spark clusters with capital letters clusters

trans-unit.source: Clusters that had DNS names specified in capital letters had issues with Jupyter notebooks due to an origin request check.
trans-unit.target: Clusters that had DNS names specified in capital letters had issues with Jupyter notebooks due to an origin request check.

trans-unit.source: The fix was to change the DNS name for Jupyter's configuration to lower case.
trans-unit.target: The fix was to change the DNS name for Jupyter's configuration to lower case.

trans-unit.source: Changes in VM name format for deploying multiple HDInsight on Linux clusters in a single Virtual Network
trans-unit.target: Changes in VM name format for deploying multiple HDInsight on Linux clusters in a single Virtual Network

trans-unit.source: Support for deploying multiple HDInsight Linux clusters in a single virtual network is being added in this release.
trans-unit.target: Support for deploying multiple HDInsight Linux clusters in a single virtual network is being added in this release.

trans-unit.source: As part of this, the format of virtual machine names in the cluster has changed from headnode\*, workernode\* and zookeepernode\* to hn\*, wn\*, and zk\* respectively.
trans-unit.target: As part of this, the format of virtual machine names in the cluster has changed from headnode\*, workernode\* and zookeepernode\* to hn\*, wn\*, and zk\* respectively.

trans-unit.source: It is not a recommended practice to take a direct dependency on the format of virtual machine names, since this is subject to change.
trans-unit.target: It is not a recommended practice to take a direct dependency on the format of virtual machine names, since this is subject to change.

trans-unit.source: Please use "hostname -f" on the local machine or Ambari APIs to determine the list of hosts, and the mapping of components to hosts.
trans-unit.target: Please use "hostname -f" on the local machine or Ambari APIs to determine the list of hosts, and the mapping of components to hosts.

trans-unit.source: You can find more info at [https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/docs/api/v1/hosts.md](https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/docs/api/v1/hosts.md) and [https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/docs/api/v1/host-components.md](https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/docs/api/v1/host-components.md).
trans-unit.target: You can find more info at [https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/docs/api/v1/hosts.md](https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/docs/api/v1/hosts.md) and [https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/docs/api/v1/host-components.md](https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/docs/api/v1/host-components.md).

trans-unit.source: The cloud service now opens 5 ports 8001 to 8005 on the cluster E.g.
trans-unit.target: The cloud service now opens 5 ports 8001 to 8005 on the cluster E.g.

trans-unit.source: Requests to these URLs are authenticated using the same basic authentication password mechanism as port 443.
trans-unit.target: Requests to these URLs are authenticated using the same basic authentication password mechanism as port 443.

trans-unit.source: These ports bind to the same port on the active headnode.
trans-unit.target: These ports bind to the same port on the active headnode.

trans-unit.source: Script actions can be used to make customer services listen on these ports on the headnode and route to outside the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Script actions can be used to make customer services listen on these ports on the headnode and route to outside the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Change to Default Yarn Container Memory Configuration
trans-unit.target: Change to Default Yarn Container Memory Configuration

trans-unit.source: In this update, the default available memory to YARN containers (yarn.nodemanager.resource.memory-mb and yarn.scheduler.maximum-allocation-mb), launched by Node Manager, is increased to 5632MB.
trans-unit.target: In this update, the default available memory to YARN containers (yarn.nodemanager.resource.memory-mb and yarn.scheduler.maximum-allocation-mb), launched by Node Manager, is increased to 5632MB.

trans-unit.source: Previously this was reduced to 4608MB, but based on various job runs, the new value must offer better reliability and performance to most jobs, hence is a better default.
trans-unit.target: Previously this was reduced to 4608MB, but based on various job runs, the new value must offer better reliability and performance to most jobs, hence is a better default.

trans-unit.source: As usual, if you a have critical dependency on this memory configuration, please set it explicitly while creating the cluster.
trans-unit.target: As usual, if you a have critical dependency on this memory configuration, please set it explicitly while creating the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Default Config parity for HBase and Storm clusters
trans-unit.target: Default Config parity for HBase and Storm clusters

trans-unit.source: This update restores Hbase and Storm clusters to use the same values of YARN configs as Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: This update restores Hbase and Storm clusters to use the same values of YARN configs as Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: This is done for parity across all cluster types.
trans-unit.target: This is done for parity across all cluster types.

trans-unit.target: Changed YARN configuration yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications to 1000 for all cluster types for HDInsight versions 3.1 and 3.2.

trans-unit.source: Public APIs provided by sites like Twitter are a useful source of data for analyzing and understanding popular trends.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, learn how to use Hive to get a list of Twitter users that sent the most tweets containing a particular word.

trans-unit.source: Apache Mahout is an Apache Hadoop machine learning library.
trans-unit.target: Apache Mahout is an Apache Hadoop machine learning library.

trans-unit.source: Mahout contains algorithms for processing data (such as filtering, classification, and clustering).

trans-unit.source: Change to default value for Hive configuration: hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask.size
trans-unit.target: Change to default value for Hive configuration: hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask.size

trans-unit.source: This size configuration applies to automatically converted map joins.
trans-unit.target: This size configuration applies to automatically converted map joins.

trans-unit.source: The value represents the sum of the sizes of tables that can be converted to hash maps that fit in memory.
trans-unit.target: The value represents the sum of the sizes of tables that can be converted to hash maps that fit in memory.

trans-unit.source: In a prior release, this value increased from the default value of 10 MB to 128 MB.
trans-unit.target: In a prior release, this value increased from the default value of 10 MB to 128 MB.

trans-unit.source: However, the new value of 128 MB was causing jobs to fail due to lack of memory.
trans-unit.target: However, the new value of 128 MB was causing jobs to fail due to lack of memory.

trans-unit.source: This release reverts the default value back to 10 MB.
trans-unit.target: This release reverts the default value back to 10 MB.

trans-unit.source: Customers can still choose to override this value during cluster creation, given their queries and table sizes.
trans-unit.target: Customers can still choose to override this value during cluster creation, given their queries and table sizes.

trans-unit.target: For more information about this setting and how to override it, see

trans-unit.source: Bug fix: Intermittent error while adding large numbers of partitions to a table in a Hive DDL
trans-unit.target: Bug fix: Intermittent error while adding large numbers of partitions to a table in a Hive DDL

trans-unit.source: If there is an intermittent connection error with the Hive metastore database when adding a lot of partitions to a Hive table, the Hive DDL can fail.
trans-unit.target: If there is an intermittent connection error with the Hive metastore database when adding a lot of partitions to a Hive table, the Hive DDL can fail.

trans-unit.source: The following statement will be seen in the Hive error log if this failure occurs:
trans-unit.target: The following statement will be seen in the Hive error log if this failure occurs:

trans-unit.source: "ERROR [main]: ql.Driver (SessionState.java:printError(547)) - FAILED: Execution Error, return code 1 from org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.DDLTask.
trans-unit.target: "ERROR [main]: ql.Driver (SessionState.java:printError(547)) - FAILED: Execution Error, return code 1 from org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.DDLTask.

trans-unit.source: This probably indicates that there are unbalanced calls to openTransaction/commitTransaction)"

trans-unit.source: Ability to programmatically enumerate applications that have been run on your clusters and to download relevant application-specific or container-specific logs to help debug problematic applications.
trans-unit.target: Ability to programmatically enumerate applications that have been run on your clusters and to download relevant application-specific or container-specific logs to help debug problematic applications.

trans-unit.source: Ability to specify region name in IHdInsightClient.DeleteCluster
trans-unit.target: Ability to specify region name in IHdInsightClient.DeleteCluster

trans-unit.source: The Azure HDInsight SDK provides the ability to specify a region name when using **DeleteCluster**.
trans-unit.target: The Azure HDInsight SDK provides the ability to specify a region name when using **DeleteCluster**.

trans-unit.source: This helps unblock customers who had two resources with same name in different regions and had been unable to delete either of them.
trans-unit.target: This helps unblock customers who had two resources with same name in different regions and had been unable to delete either of them.

trans-unit.source: The **ClusterDetails** object returns a **DeploymentID** field that represents a unique identifier for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The **ClusterDetails** object returns a **DeploymentID** field that represents a unique identifier for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: It is guaranteed to be unique across cluster creation attempts with the same names.
trans-unit.target: It is guaranteed to be unique across cluster creation attempts with the same names.

trans-unit.source: This release contains the following new features, component updates, and bug fixes.
trans-unit.target: This release contains the following new features, component updates, and bug fixes.

trans-unit.source: Preview of the cluster customization feature that enables modification of Hadoop clusters in arbitrary ways by using custom scripts.
trans-unit.target: Preview of the cluster customization feature that enables modification of Hadoop clusters in arbitrary ways by using custom scripts.

trans-unit.source: With this feature, users can experiment with and deploy projects that are available from the Apache Hadoop ecosystem to Azure HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: With this feature, users can experiment with and deploy projects that are available from the Apache Hadoop ecosystem to Azure HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: This customization feature is available on all types of HDInsight clusters, including Hadoop, HBase, and Storm.
trans-unit.target: This customization feature is available on all types of HDInsight clusters, including Hadoop, HBase, and Storm.

trans-unit.source: Prebuilt jobs for Azure websites and storage log analysis
trans-unit.target: Prebuilt jobs for Azure websites and storage log analysis

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Query Console has a Getting Started gallery that supports solutions that work on your data or on sample data.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Query Console has a Getting Started gallery that supports solutions that work on your data or on sample data.

trans-unit.source: Weve created jobs for some of the most common data analysis scenarios to provide a starting point for creating your own solutions.
trans-unit.target: Weve created jobs for some of the most common data analysis scenarios to provide a starting point for creating your own solutions.

trans-unit.source: You can use your data with the job to see how it works.
trans-unit.target: You can use your data with the job to see how it works.

trans-unit.source: Then when you are ready, use what you have learned to create a solution that is modeled after the prebuilt job.
trans-unit.target: Then when you are ready, use what you have learned to create a solution that is modeled after the prebuilt job.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to work with HDInsight by walking through some basic scenarios (such as analyzing web logs and sensor data).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to work with HDInsight by walking through some basic scenarios (such as analyzing web logs and sensor data).

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to use HDInsight to analyze such data and how you can connect other applications and services to this data.
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to use HDInsight to analyze such data and how you can connect other applications and services to this data.

trans-unit.source: Visualizing data by connecting to Microsoft Excel provides an example of the power of this approach.
trans-unit.target: Visualizing data by connecting to Microsoft Excel provides an example of the power of this approach.

trans-unit.source: A memory leak in Templeton that affected customers who had long running clusters or were submitting 100s of job requests a second has been addressed.
trans-unit.target: A memory leak in Templeton that affected customers who had long running clusters or were submitting 100s of job requests a second has been addressed.

trans-unit.source: The issue manifested as Templeton 5xx errors and the workaround was to restart the service.
trans-unit.target: The issue manifested as Templeton 5xx errors and the workaround was to restart the service.

trans-unit.source: The workaround is no longer needed.
trans-unit.target: The workaround is no longer needed.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: To demonstrate the new capabilities made available by cluster customization, the procedures using Script Action to install Spark and R modules on a cluster have been documented.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: To demonstrate the new capabilities made available by cluster customization, the procedures using Script Action to install Spark and R modules on a cluster have been documented.

trans-unit.target: [Install and use R on HDInsight Hadoop clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-r-scripts.md)

trans-unit.source: This release contains the following component updates.
trans-unit.target: This release contains the following component updates.

trans-unit.source: This release is based on Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP) 2.1.7.
trans-unit.target: This release is based on Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP) 2.1.7.

trans-unit.source: The YARN Timeline Server (also known as the Generic Application History Server) has been enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: The YARN Timeline Server (also known as the Generic Application History Server) has been enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: The Timeline Server provides generic information about completed applications (such as application ID, application name, application status, application submission time, and application completion time).
trans-unit.target: The Timeline Server provides generic information about completed applications (such as application ID, application name, application status, application submission time, and application completion time).

trans-unit.source: This application information can be retrieved from the head node by accessing the URI http://headnodehost:8188 or by running the YARN command: yarn application list appStates ALL.
trans-unit.target: This application information can be retrieved from the head node by accessing the URI http://headnodehost:8188 or by running the YARN command: yarn application list appStates ALL.

trans-unit.source: This information can also be retrieved remotely though a REST API at https://{ClusterDnsName}.
trans-unit.target: This information can also be retrieved remotely though a REST API at https://{ClusterDnsName}.

trans-unit.source: Starting with SDK version 1.3.3.1.5426.29232, users can access a unique ID for each cluster, which is issued HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Starting with SDK version 1.3.3.1.5426.29232, users can access a unique ID for each cluster, which is issued HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: This enables customers to figure out unique instances of clusters when a DNS name is being reused across create or drop scenarios.
trans-unit.target: This enables customers to figure out unique instances of clusters when a DNS name is being reused across create or drop scenarios.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: The bug that prevented the full version number from showing up in the portal or from being returned by the SDK or by Windows PowerShell has been fixed in this release.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: The bug that prevented the full version number from showing up in the portal or from being returned by the SDK or by Windows PowerShell has been fixed in this release.

trans-unit.source: This hotfix release fixed a memory leak in Templeton that affected the heavy users of Templeton.
trans-unit.target: This hotfix release fixed a memory leak in Templeton that affected the heavy users of Templeton.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, users who exercised Templeton heavily would see errors manifested as 500 error codes because the requests would not have enough memory to run.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, users who exercised Templeton heavily would see errors manifested as 500 error codes because the requests would not have enough memory to run.

trans-unit.source: The workaround for this issue was to restart the Templeton service.
trans-unit.target: The workaround for this issue was to restart the Templeton service.

trans-unit.source: When using Ambari endpoint, "https://{clusterDns}.azurehdinsight.net/ambari/api/v1/clusters/{clusterDns}.azurehdinsight.net/services/{servicename}/components/{componentname}", the *host_name* field returns the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the node instead of only the host name.
trans-unit.target: When using Ambari endpoint, "https://{clusterDns}.azurehdinsight.net/ambari/api/v1/clusters/{clusterDns}.azurehdinsight.net/services/{servicename}/components/{componentname}", the *host_name* field returns the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the node instead of only the host name.

trans-unit.target: For example, instead of returning "**headnode0**", you get the FQDN **headnode0.{ClusterDNS}.azurehdinsight.net**.

trans-unit.source: The result is a failure in some job submission operations.

trans-unit.source: If you use HDInsight SDK APIs or Azure PowerShell cmdlets (**Use-AzureRmHDInsightCluster** or **Invoke-AzureRmHDInsightHiveJob**) to submit jobs, those operations may fail with the error message "*Cluster <clustername> is not configured for HTTP services access*."
trans-unit.target: If you use HDInsight SDK APIs or Azure PowerShell cmdlets (**Use-AzureRmHDInsightCluster** or **Invoke-AzureRmHDInsightHiveJob**) to submit jobs, those operations may fail with the error message "*Cluster <clustername> is not configured for HTTP services access*."

trans-unit.source: Or (depending on the operation), you may get other error messages, such as "*Cannot connect to cluster*".
trans-unit.target: Or (depending on the operation), you may get other error messages, such as "*Cannot connect to cluster*".

trans-unit.source: This release contains enhancements to the HDInsight service:
trans-unit.target: This release contains enhancements to the HDInsight service:

trans-unit.source: **HDP 2.1 availability**: HDInsight 3.1 (which contains HDP 2.1) is generally available and is the default version for new clusters.
trans-unit.target: **HDP 2.1 availability**: HDInsight 3.1 (which contains HDP 2.1) is generally available and is the default version for new clusters.

trans-unit.source: **HBase Azure portal improvements**: We are making HBase clusters available in Preview.
trans-unit.target: **HBase Azure portal improvements**: We are making HBase clusters available in Preview.

trans-unit.source: You can create HBase clusters from the portal with just a few clicks.
trans-unit.target: You can create HBase clusters from the portal with just a few clicks.

trans-unit.source: With HBase, you can build a variety of real-time workloads on HDInsight, from interactive websites that work with large datasets to services storing sensor and telemetry data from millions of end points.
trans-unit.target: With HBase, you can build a variety of real-time workloads on HDInsight, from interactive websites that work with large datasets to services storing sensor and telemetry data from millions of end points.

trans-unit.source: The next step would be to analyze the data in these workloads with Hadoop jobs, and this is possible in HDInsight through Azure PowerShell and the Hive cluster dashboard.
trans-unit.target: The next step would be to analyze the data in these workloads with Hadoop jobs, and this is possible in HDInsight through Azure PowerShell and the Hive cluster dashboard.

trans-unit.target: [Mahout](http://hortonworks.com/hadoop/mahout/) is pre-installed on HDInsight 3.1 Hadoop clusters, so you can run Mahout jobs without the need for additional cluster configuration.

trans-unit.target: You can enable Tez by running the following code snippet:

trans-unit.source: With the release of HDInsight on Hadoop 2.2, Microsoft has made HDInsight available in all major geographies where Azure is available.
trans-unit.target: With the release of HDInsight on Hadoop 2.2, Microsoft has made HDInsight available in all major geographies where Azure is available.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, the west Europe and southeast Asia datacenters have been brought online.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, the west Europe and southeast Asia datacenters have been brought online.

trans-unit.source: This enables customers to locate clusters in a datacenter that is close and potentially in a zone of similar compliance requirements.
trans-unit.target: This enables customers to locate clusters in a datacenter that is close and potentially in a zone of similar compliance requirements.

trans-unit.source: **Oozie metastores used with an HDInsight 3.1 cluster are not backward compatible with HDInsight 2.1 clusters, and they cannot be used with this previous version**.
trans-unit.target: **Oozie metastores used with an HDInsight 3.1 cluster are not backward compatible with HDInsight 2.1 clusters, and they cannot be used with this previous version**.

trans-unit.source: A custom Oozie metastore database deployed with an HDInsight 3.1 cluster cannot be reused with an HDInsight 2.1 cluster.
trans-unit.target: A custom Oozie metastore database deployed with an HDInsight 3.1 cluster cannot be reused with an HDInsight 2.1 cluster.

trans-unit.source: This is the case even if the metastore originated with an HDInsight 2.1 cluster.
trans-unit.target: This is the case even if the metastore originated with an HDInsight 2.1 cluster.

trans-unit.source: This scenario is not supported because the metastore schema gets upgraded when used with an HDInsight 3.1 cluster, so it is no longer compatible with the metastore required by the HDInsight 2.1 clusters.
trans-unit.target: This scenario is not supported because the metastore schema gets upgraded when used with an HDInsight 3.1 cluster, so it is no longer compatible with the metastore required by the HDInsight 2.1 clusters.

trans-unit.source: Any attempt to reuse an Oozie metastore that has been used with an HDInsight 3.1 cluster will render the HDInsight 2.1 cluster useless.
trans-unit.target: Any attempt to reuse an Oozie metastore that has been used with an HDInsight 3.1 cluster will render the HDInsight 2.1 cluster useless.

trans-unit.source: **Oozie metastores cannot be shared across clusters.**
trans-unit.target: **Oozie metastores cannot be shared across clusters.**

trans-unit.source: Oozie metastores are attached to specific clusters, and they cannot be shared across clusters.
trans-unit.target: Oozie metastores are attached to specific clusters, and they cannot be shared across clusters.

trans-unit.source: **Prefix syntax**: Only the "wasb://" syntax is supported in HDInsight 3.1 and 3.0 clusters.
trans-unit.target: **Prefix syntax**: Only the "wasb://" syntax is supported in HDInsight 3.1 and 3.0 clusters.

trans-unit.source: The older "asv://" syntax is supported in HDInsight 2.1 and 1.6 clusters, but it is not supported in HDInsight 3.1 or 3.0 clusters.
trans-unit.target: The older "asv://" syntax is supported in HDInsight 2.1 and 1.6 clusters, but it is not supported in HDInsight 3.1 or 3.0 clusters.

trans-unit.source: This means that any jobs submitted to an HDInsight 3.1 or 3.0 cluster that explicitly use the "asv://" syntax will fail.
trans-unit.target: This means that any jobs submitted to an HDInsight 3.1 or 3.0 cluster that explicitly use the "asv://" syntax will fail.

trans-unit.source: The "wasb://" syntax should be used instead.
trans-unit.target: The "wasb://" syntax should be used instead.

trans-unit.source: Also, jobs submitted to any HDInsight 3.1 or 3.0 clusters that are created with an existing metastore that contains explicit references to resources using the "asv://" syntax will fail.
trans-unit.target: Also, jobs submitted to any HDInsight 3.1 or 3.0 clusters that are created with an existing metastore that contains explicit references to resources using the "asv://" syntax will fail.

trans-unit.source: These metastores need to be re-created using the "wasb://" syntax to address resources.
trans-unit.target: These metastores need to be re-created using the "wasb://" syntax to address resources.

trans-unit.source: **Ports**: The ports used by the HDInsight service have changed.
trans-unit.target: **Ports**: The ports used by the HDInsight service have changed.

trans-unit.source: The port numbers that were being used were within the ephemeral port range of the Windows operating system.
trans-unit.target: The port numbers that were being used were within the ephemeral port range of the Windows operating system.

trans-unit.source: Ports are allocated automatically from a predefined ephemeral range for short-lived Internet protocol-based communications.
trans-unit.target: Ports are allocated automatically from a predefined ephemeral range for short-lived Internet protocol-based communications.

trans-unit.source: The new set of allowed Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP) service port numbers are outside this range to avoid encountering conflicts that could arise with the ports used by services running on the head node.
trans-unit.target: The new set of allowed Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP) service port numbers are outside this range to avoid encountering conflicts that could arise with the ports used by services running on the head node.
